criteria: Accurately partitions circles and rectangles into two and four equal shares.
Correctly describes the shares using the words halves, fourths, and quarters.
Effectively uses the phrases half of, fourth of, and quarter of to describe parts of a whole.
Understands and describes the whole as two of or four of the shares.
Understands that decomposing into more equal shares creates smaller shares.
descriptions: Student is unable to partition circles or rectangles into equal shares.
Student attempts to partition shapes but struggles to create equal shares.
Student can partition circles and rectangles into two equal shares (halves) with limited accuracy.
Student can partition circles and rectangles into two and four equal shares with reasonable accuracy.
Student consistently and accurately partitions circles and rectangles into two and four equal shares.
Student expertly and accurately partitions circles and rectangles into two and four equal shares, demonstrating a strong understanding of equal parts.
Student does not use or incorrectly uses the terms halves, fourths, and quarters.
Student attempts to use the terms but demonstrates confusion or misapplication.
Student can identify halves but struggles with fourths and quarters.
Student can correctly use the terms halves, fourths, and quarters to describe shares in most cases.
Student consistently and accurately uses the terms halves, fourths, and quarters to describe shares.
Student fluently and accurately uses the terms halves, fourths, and quarters, demonstrating a nuanced understanding of their meaning.
Student does not use or incorrectly uses the phrases half of, fourth of, and quarter of.
Student attempts to use the phrases but demonstrates confusion or misapplication.
Student can use 'half of' correctly in simple situations, but struggles with 'fourth of' and 'quarter of'.
Student can correctly use the phrases 'half of', 'fourth of', and 'quarter of' to describe parts of a whole in most cases.
Student consistently and accurately uses the phrases 'half of', 'fourth of', and 'quarter of' to describe parts of a whole.
Student expertly and accurately uses the phrases 'half of', 'fourth of', and 'quarter of', demonstrating a deep comprehension of fractional parts.
Student cannot relate the shares back to the whole.
Student attempts to relate shares to the whole but demonstrates confusion.
Student can describe the whole as two halves but struggles to articulate the relationship with fourths and quarters.
Student can describe the whole as two halves or four quarters in most cases.
Student consistently and accurately describes the whole as two halves or four quarters.
Student demonstrates a complete understanding of how shares combine to make a whole and can clearly articulate this relationship in various contexts.
Student does not demonstrate an understanding that more shares result in smaller shares.
